Reviews.Title: “You'll be pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: turrethouse
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about booking this hotel after reading some of the negative reviews, but can tell you they are undeserved. The property is well maintained, the rooms and linens clean, furnishings attractive and the management and staff are superior. A true value for your dollar for those looking for above average lodging at budget prices. I enjoyed my time by the pool and also ate dinner at the attached coffee shop restaurant which featured "home style" comfort food. As a retired flight attendant, I have stayed at hundreds of hotels and understand what a traveler is looking for in their lodging requirements. It's not a luxury resort, but then neither are the rates. The location is also an added plus as it is nearby to many of San Diego's attractions, Balboa Park, downtown and the beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: nursemel25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding...trust me, there are dozens of hotels nearby this one, ANY ONE of them would have been better than this dump!!! They need to renovate ASAP!! Smelly, creepy, old...need I say more? My mom also stayed here and her room stunk like they tried to cover up the smell of cigarettes with nasty air freshener! And the phone in the room didn't even work. When I first checked in the door to my hotel rm was wide open so any creepy person could have wandered in and hid in the closet or bathtub...real safe. Glad I didn't end up with bed bugs. Do not stay at this dump!!!

Reviews.Title: “Grooooooosssss”
Reviews.Author: Megan S
Reviews.Content: I came here with 4friends and first of all the room was so small with very little walking space. My bed had crumbs in it, the floor had chili stains on it, the shower tiles were all chipped, there was hair in my bath tub, hair in the blow dryer, a hole in the wall that was covered by a picture frame....the drawers had no handles, and my towels were wet and very small! Horrible horrible horrible don't ever wanna go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Resort? Uuuummmm No Not Really”
Reviews.Author: Julie S
Reviews.Content: If you like this place you have very low standards. The name is a huge lie. I had no idea when booking it that you should stay clear of Hotel Circle, lesson learned. Not only was it unclean, the beds were low quality (big issue with me), the staff was slow and the restaurant next door, whom they use for their room service, should be shut down. The food sat in my stomach like a ball of lead. That is until the gas started, the whole group not just me. It ruined our get away. It's hard to enjjoy sight seeing when you feel like crap

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mickey108
Reviews.Content: Was very disappointed with the Mission Valley Resort. I'd rank it below a Motel 6. The towels and sheets were thin, the safe in the closet had the door broken off, one of the pictures above one of the two double beds was missing. The light fixture above the sink was pitted as was the mirror. The whole place looked like it could have used an serious update. The most positive thing I could say was that the room was clean. The maids did a fine job everyday of tidying the room and the bathroom. On the weekday there was good coffee in the lobby. I would not stay at this "Resort" in the future

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, locations and amenities all for a great rate”
Reviews.Author: SeasonedTraveler1967
Reviews.Content: My experience being a frequent guest of the Mission Valley Resort is always a pleasant one. The MVR is a full service hotel with the a restaurant called the Valley Kitchen which incidentally is very popular with the locals as well. The staff at this hotel cares. The guest rooms are well appointed and very large and offer all the amenities of a five star hotel. For the rate, amenities, service and location there is not better deal than the Mission Valley Resort.

Reviews.Title: “This is not Resort it a hotel”
Reviews.Author: tlcbear411
Reviews.Content: This is still a okay place to stay , but the night time staff was not so good, I check in alittle after midnight, the guy at the front desk said I almost missed out on my check in time because it was after midnight. He put me in room 556, this room smell like fresh urine, We sat on the bed and the scent was strong, called the front desk, he could not do any thing but tell me to come to the front desk and get clean sheet, I went to the front desk to get the clean sheets and found out that the sheet he gave me did not fit the bed. I waited until 7 am and called the front desk again and the morning staff move me to room 152, this was a very nice room, I still had some problems I walked around the resort and all the information on the web was not correct, they stated there a work out area, found out this has been close since 10/2011, they stated we get a free breakfast no one knew any thing about it, until my check out date I over heard a staff member telling another customer where to go to get breakfast. I was upset because when I ask the front desk they said they do not offer breakfast. Then I tried to used the computer in the hotel lobby and that was like use a tuttle and they give you 5 min to use it per guest. I use my own laptop and still had a problem connecting to the wifi. It still close to a few nice area I went to Balboa Park, This is a must see if you going to be in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place and staff members”
Reviews.Author: bod m
Reviews.Content: We stayed through the second week of January and enjoyed our trip. The personnel upon check-in was remarkable. Our room was on first floor because we asked for; it had been a large room for $39, fresh and bedsheets was cool and cozy. It was also very tranquil and so our sleep was perfect. The hotel is bigger than I estimated along with the exotic backyard areas, the pool area were fun. We had booked a rental car and it was easy getting in and out from the hotel to get down to the city or the beach. We will stay here again next time at the same price I hope.

Reviews.Title: “Run run run”
Reviews.Author: jennifer w
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last year and booked through JetBlue. Horrible mistake. The trip was for me and my son and it was our first trip to Cali and the hotel was a disappointment. It was in dire need of repair. The bathroom was horrible and dirty and this was an upgraded room. I made my son shower with his flip flops on. The place was totally gross.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Skitahoe1234
Reviews.Content: I've been to San Diego before, but this was the first time I stayed at this hotel. I got a very low price online, and was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the hotel. The rooms are a bit run down, but clean. The staff was very nice, and I liked the sports bar. Overall, I would have expected less for the price, and I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego on the Cheap”
Reviews.Author: JimB1966
Reviews.Content: Recently, while on a business trip, I booked two nights at the Mission Valley Resort. My company had put me up in a expensive down-town hotel for two nights and I elected to stay on my own dime for a few days just for a little R&R. The company paid hotel was $200/night. I could go on and on about the differences, some slight some not so slight but in the end, Mission Valley Resort was safe, clean and centrally located. It had ample room for me to park my car, a nice swimming pool and a really, really convenient family restaurant and shop connected to it and with the money I saved, I was able to buy and eat like a king in La Jolla and Laguna Beach. I guess you could say, I did San Diego on the cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: Momwith2teens
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times now, This hotel is good IF YOU book one of the superior rooms. The standard rooms are fair but outdated. The price is reflective of that. It is well worth the extra $10 a night to book the superior room. The standard rooms are very small but you can get them cheap on their web site. The hotel is right at the entrance to interstate 8 so it is really easy to get wherever you need, Sea world, Mission beach, La Jolla, ect ect. The staff here are always helpful, and there is a Restaurant, convenience store, and gas at the front of the hotel. I would stay here again if I can get the superior room. Parking is more than ample no matter what you drive. There is always security around night or day. The rooms are clean and I have never found a bug in any of our rooms. There are a lot of plants around the grounds so there are some creepy crawlers outside, but never in the rooms. The price seems to fluctuate dramatically during the year so check the prices before you go.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic, perfect location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: Latina1234
Reviews.Content: It's not the ritz but for $40 it was just what I needed! Great location, nice staff, super basic, but I'd come back especially in the summer so I could get in one of their awesome pools.

Reviews.Title: “A Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: CallinItLikeItIs
Reviews.Content: Last year I had a big party in one of the banquet rooms. I even stayed in one of the rooms. I was able to give a great review then. But I didn't know about the other rooms being so bad. The room we had was much better than the one we just rented over Thanksgiving. This time we rented a "family unit" so that my mother could have her own room. This unit was sooooo old and looked like it hadn't had an upgrade since it was built. Carpet was frayed and bathroom door was corroded at the bottom. Toilet didn't flush right. Furniture and appliances were not properly arranged: one TV in a armoire that was placed so that you couldn't even watch it from the bed. Only one desk chair for sitting. We asked for some additional chairs but told none were available. So we grabbed some chairs from outside! Refrigerator and microwave were placed in the extra bedroom instead of the little room with the coffee pot. For San Diego, we got what we paid for. All the hotels in Mission Valley are old! Anything newer would most likely cost way more. The people were good and my husband got to enjoy the football game in the bar. We just won't be staying there again, though. Can't count on getting a good room there. Our last room was nice, but this one was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “No hospitality value but ok area”
Reviews.Author: Mvated
Reviews.Content: Long line to check in with an 16 year old front desk clerk. Make sure to keep yourself busy as You hear everything in rooms along side and above. Nearby diner is average but very friendly. Overall blahh but on an tight budget it works.

Reviews.Title: “Resort? Ha!”
Reviews.Author: Pam57106
Reviews.Content: They call this place a resort, but instead you should picture a 1960's motel that is old and run down. Yes, it is large with a lot of land, but the land is mostly asphalt. One of the pools and the tennis court are actually at the fitness center behind the hotel. We were never invited to use the facilities there, so I don't know how they can claim it as part of their so called "resort". We didn't want to spend any more time than necessary there, so basically just went there for sleeping. I was hoping to have a nice "get-away" place with my husband, and this wasn't it.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: constanttraveller94
Reviews.Content: to call this hotel a flea pit is not fair on fleas. Dogs are allowed but this place is worse than a kennel. We were booked in by our travel agents and when I read the reviews on trip advisor I was concerned but it was too late to do anything about changing this reservation. I will be complaining to the travel agents. It seems the hotel!!!! had abeen sold 3 days prior to our arrival. Disgusting filthy horrible

Reviews.Title: “Disaster”
Reviews.Author: rkasirer
Reviews.Content: This motel is a disaster! It is dirty and the service is terrible. Their website is very deceiving. They no longer have a gym, a bar, or a lap pool, which they advertise as having. Everything in the room felt yucky, from the glasses that had crust in them, to the coffee mugs that still had coffee in them and the blankets that had tons of holes in them, possibly cigarette burns...Thankfully its on "Hotel Circle" so there were other options. I checked right out and went to a different hotel down the street. I still get the itchies when I think of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Mission Valley Resort not as bad as some reviews I read..”
Reviews.Author: Delta2011_11
Reviews.Content: Before we left for our road trip, which included San Diego, we booked a three night stay at the Mission Valley Resort. We read the reviews and were somewhat nervous about booking this hotel. The price was right and the location was good. When we arrived I was prepared for the worst and have to admit that I was somewhat pleased to find a very average hotel. The room was clean. The pool area was very nice. The staff pleasant and helpful. The onsite restaurant good and the bar was fun as well. I didn't get the name of the fellow who was the server in the bar, but he was great. All in all the stay was okay. I may not return to this hotel, but if you do choose to book this hotel, just keep in mind that you get what you pay for. It is not a three star hotel. It also has acces to a gym, that my husband used and he was impressed with the gym.

Reviews.Title: “BUSINESS CENTER?? INTERNET??? TERRIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: mgannon2011
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean, but very small. One good thing, it is close to everything. But I have to mention what a disappointment it was with the so called "business center" and internet. I was on a business trip, not vacation, and I needed internet. They do have, but it is down every 10 min (no kidding!!! ). It is was basically impossible to work out of the room. So I tried to go to the "business center", which I found out consisted of only one computer (very old) and one printer. This computer does not have any programs at all, so even to open a Word or Excel attachment on my email was impossible, as they don't have them. It was very frustrating when I was trying to work and ended up having to go to the nearest Starbucks so I could have decent internet. Could not change hotels because it was prepaid for my entire stay. SO, IF YOU ARE GOING FOR BUSINESS, DO NOT STAY THERE, BECAUSE YOU WILL BARELY BE ABLE TO CHECK YOUR EMAIL.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Visit”
Reviews.Author: Beverley R
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice as a family of four. We haven't had the problems that other visitors have experienced with smelly rooms! Our room was perfectly clean and adequate for our needs. We just want a good base at an affordable price so that we can get out and explore San Diego. We asked to be in a room in Block 8, so that we could be close to the pool which was great for our teenage boys. It is close to Fashion Valley for brilliant shopping and the lovely "Old Town", with easy access to the roads for the beaches and city centre. Simple, basic and clean and we will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “RESORT TO WHAT?”
Reviews.Author: Marjie B
Reviews.Content: The room that was given to us smelled so bad and the paint was pealing off the walls. They reassigned us to another room, but I would never recommend this hotle to anyone and if this is the type of hotel Expedia gives 3 stars to, watch out!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE ..WE LEFT AFTER TRYING OUT 3 ROOMS!”
Reviews.Author: becky l
Reviews.Content: The first room we were given had hair in the bathroom floor and sink, was smelly, and carpet was filthy. We complained and were given another room and there was blood on the bedspread. Went to check out and was given one of their "suites." Was this ever a joke. The carpet was so black we could not let the baby go barefoot. Carpet was buckled up and fire alarm wasnt working, smell was so bad. Mustard on the ceiling and dried blood on the walls. We even took a wash cloth and tried to clean it. We packed up and left and found a wonderful place down the street. I would rather sleep in my car than in a room that dirty. The pictures shown on the web must have been 50 yrs ago!! My daughter had a conference there and the conference bathrooms had blood all over the floor!! What is up with all the blood.....yuck!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting! Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Rebley
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel using Expedia's unpublished rate system. We thought we were getting a 3 star hotel. NO WAY is this place anywhere close to 3 stars. Maybe 1 1/2 stars and that's pushing it. We were give a room and upon entering noticed a bad smell. Look up at the ceiling and there is water damage and black mold. Room was TINY and the bathroom was a joke. Called asked for a different room, different room same smell and more mold. Wall paper was peeling, and molding the bathroom was really beat up and missing paint in places. Carpet was disgusting. Hair in the bathtub, just gross. Furniture was outdated and the sheets were poor quality. Upon examining the outside we noticed several of the buildings had blue tarps tacked to the their roofs to try and prevent further water damage. Had had enough and called expedia, after 2 hours we were refunded and got the heck out of there. Almost ruined our vacation. The only good thing about this place is the hotel agreed to refund our money.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities, smelly rooms”
Reviews.Author: SoBeRetired
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Mission Valley maybe 20 days over the past 18 months, mostly because the room prices are consistently very low, and the room rental includes admission to Frog's Fitness Center and Athletic Club, which is directly behind the motel. For the price, the facilities of the motel--pool, hot tub, on premises restaurant, bar, and convenience store--can't be beat, and Frog's is a real gym--aerobic equipment, weight machines, free weights, spa, showers. The downside is that the rooms are a bit smelly and the carpets are old, stained, and don't feel entirely clean. Also, my room this last time had very weak Internet connectivity, something I have not noticed in other rooms before. If you're in the market for a bargain place to stay, don't mind old carpets, and like to workout when you travel, this is a great deal. If you want elegance...better try someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Most awful dump I've ever been in”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBaldy
Reviews.Content: This place was so bad I don't know where to begin. We went to SD for a wedding, and this place was one of three "recommended" by the wedding party as possibles, with this being on the low end price-wise. I'm happy to get by for less money, and never suspected that it would be on the wedding party's list unless they knew it was decent. Where do I start? Filthy and disgusting room. Carpet so dirty my sox were black. We upgraded from a dingy small room to a balcony room, shown in one of the photos here. So we had enough space because it was larger, and could open the door for fresh air. But the wallpaper was peeling off the walls in many places, the light bar in the bathroom was completely corroded, shower curtain bar corroded, mold around the tub, cracked floor tiles, cracked shower tiles, sink cabinet so gross I wouldn't put anything there. So we wanted to put clothes on the closet shelf, and my wife gave me a wet washcloth to dust it off. The cloth came up completely BLACK. Second wiping with other side of the cloth, BLACK. (not just dusty, but sticky caked-on black filth!) Hadn't been wiped in years. We took the black washcloth to the front desk and showed the guy - he shrugged, says they rely on housekeeping to clean the rooms, he'll talk to housekeeping about it. The exterior of the buildings is just as bad. Everything is coming apart, they must be just milking this place before they demolish it. They could never renovate this place, it would have to be demolished. My cousins came, and were so grossed out by the room they left, and for just a few dollars more, got a nice room at the Days Motel a couple of doors down. The front desk people are cocky, crummy attitude. BUT - the restaurant in front of the motel, (Country Kitchen or something like that) is wonderful. And it's operated by the hotel. What a contrast. It was clean and cheerful, the food was very good, the service was excellent, the people cheerful and gracious. We ate there a lot, and enjoyed going there. Go figure that out! ChicagoBaldy

Reviews.Title: “For the bad reviews people gave its kind of their fault”
Reviews.Author: Purpletravelor
Reviews.Content: I mean to be fair if you life in San Diego you would know there arent the best hotel/motels in Mission Valley. I live here and wanted to get out of the house and stay with my girlfriend because it was close to benehanas and Fashion Valley Mall. So I had no expectations. I can sit there and pick apart all the chipping paint and the old property that has a deceiving name. If it were called the Mission Valley Motel it might be more suitable. SO let me break down the not so obvious: Staff were surprisngly professional and nice. Rooms were older running down and the carpet was so disgusting. I spilled some white wine and went to clean it up and my towel was so black after the first wipe. Please deep clean your rooms. I didnt get a chance to look at any of the 3 pools but all and all it was what you would expect from a small motelesque property off the side of the freeway. I wouldnt return or refer any friends but I actually enjoyed my stay. If you are looking for a place strictly for sleeping bring extra socks or slippers and take off the comforter and you should have a decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: KGCT
Reviews.Content: I do not even know where to begin. What used to be a very nice facility is now very sad. Our first room had huge stains on the carpet, a bleached out spot on a bedspead, closet doors completely off, and smelled like someone sprayed air freshener to cover the obviously dingy appearance. Second room - "only other one available" was moderately better, until I pulled back one of the bedspreads to find a filthy dirty sock laying on top of the blanket. I called the front desk, no supervisor on duty, requested ALL new bedding, which was delivered with the expectation that I remake both beds. The young man saw the sock & began changing one of the beds - I changed the other. I went to the front desk the next morning, supervisor not in yet, so I left a message to please call - never received a call. I replied to "Looking forward to having you" email I had received, no response. It was not a trip we will soon forget - and for all of the wrong reasons.

Reviews.Title: “So bad we had to leave”
Reviews.Author: amyy07736
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nothing like the the pictures. Rooms are small, dirty and smelly. All but one person at front desk were complete jerks that lack any kind of customer service. I will never stay at this hotel. We were so disgusted we had to leave and go to another hotel. BEWARE unless your in desperation stay away from this s@#t hole.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Place to stay in San Diego!!!”
Reviews.Author: shawncat
Reviews.Content: First of all, beware!!! The photos online are fooling!!!! They "claim" check in time is 3pm yet we had to wait until after 4pm to check in. We had two rooms and they both smelled absolutely horrible. The room I stayed in had coffee in the coffee maker from the previous guest, a rotting cabinet in the bath (which was barely big enough for one person to stand in), the knob on the shower would not turn on unless you dinked around with it and when the water did come on you couldn't adjust the temperature, the carpet was badly stained, you sank in the beds and part of the property where other rooms were looked abandoned and raggedy!! I definitely think any other hotel in Hotel Circle would be 100x better than this dump!!!

Reviews.Title: “3 stars???? Resort???? I DON'T THINK SO!!”
Reviews.Author: dealskr
Reviews.Content: The worst place I have ever stayed! I can not believe they rented out the room we were in! The carpet was stained smelly and coming up. One of the pictures was ripped off the wall above the bed. The walls are paper thin and the beds and bedding are terrible! I have stayed in Motel 6's better then this! What this is , 3 or 4 properties that were close to each other and purchased, painted the same color and then slapped a name on it with the word RESORT in it! Who gave it 3 stars?? I had to call the front desk 3 times to get them to quite the 4 boys in the room next to us at 1130 at night. She then just argued with me! When we checked out and I complained, They looked at me with eyes wide open as the took my money and waived goodbye!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: sukar
Reviews.Content: A little old fashioned. It does need some updating but very clean and the price is very good. Pool is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “This Place Has So Much To Offer!Excellent Front Desk Staff! Saved Our Families Sanity!”
Reviews.Author: shauntelle999
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 was saved by this place! We relocated from Arizona and was in the process of finding home to live. Originally we had checked into a different hotel we found on the internet when we arrived to the other hotel we realized we had been scammed!!! Small room, stolen microwave, scary neighborhood was afraid my room would be robbed ...after staying at the other "hotel" for 2 days we drove around and came across this place. Patty the front desk room supervisor was the Best! She let us check out one of the rooms and we were sold The single room was larger, cleaner, then the other "long term hotel suite" we had been staying in and much less expensive and had so much more to offer.I am surprised that its not rated higher.The service here was Amazing! Thank you Patty for all your help! If I had more room to rave about this place it would be never ending.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Surprise Parties & Receptions!!!”
Reviews.Author: CallinItLikeItIs
Reviews.Content: The staff was super friendly, helpful & provided an excellent affordable banquet room & flexible menu for a surprise party.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: Govt-Traveller-Dale
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for 1 week, now and have experienced the following: Although the resort is a bit long in the tooth, the management is in the process of trying to upgrade everything. My room itself is spacious and has a veranda that overlooked the pool. They gave me a small refridgerator and microwave upon request. The stay includs free use of the decently sized gymnasium adjacent to the complex. The food is very good overall, and the service is prompt courteous and delightful. The location is good (just like all the hotels in that area) - close to all the major highways, a huge shopping mall, and Riverwalk golf course. The bed is a bit on the hard side for me, but I still slept pretty well. Although there hhas been some noise early in the evening, the place stays pretty quite after 10:00 P.M. The management is friendly and receptive to anything I ask of them. If there is anything that changes, or I notice later, I will amend my review then.

Reviews.Title: “smelly, unclean & noisy. Nothing like their website portrays”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1023654
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night only. The location is fine - near many other hotels in the Hotel Circle, San Diego. The room we got was old, smelled bad (dump and unclean), the room was FILTHY! hair everywhere, cigarette burns in the blankets, the bathroom had black mold stains. The bads are old, smelly and too soft. Even for the price they charge, you would expect to a decent room. As if this wasnâ€™t enough, the room was so noisy we couldnâ€™t sleep. NO WIFI!!!! No point talking to the staff. They don't seem to care too much.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: nathanielbeller3
Reviews.Content: I attend University of Phoenix in San Diego, but I live in Riverside County. Each Thursday I rent a room at the Mission Valley Resort. Brad and his staff always ensure that I have one of the best rooms, they also greet me as Mr. Beller, which makes me feel more like a business man than a student, even though I feel like I am staying with friends because I engage in a conversation with the staff while checking in and I must say that they are very nice. The staff are very friendly as well as professional to everyone. My wake up calls are always prompt, room is very neat, and the view overlooking the pool is exquisite. I enjoy each night that I reside at the Mission Valley Resort in San Diego, California. Keep up the great job Brad and staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Sunny San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: ponirabbit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just took a last minute vacation down to San Diego. What a great hotel! Rooms we very clean and the staff was friendly and courteous to us! What a great place to be near all the sites and a great place to just veg by the pool! We recommend this place to everyone! Thanks to Mission Valley for a well needed great weekend get-a-way away from the kids and work with my husband!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: Apey142
Reviews.Content: This resort was not as nice as the pictures I paid for the room to relax which is supposed to come with upgrades when available yet our room seemed like the least place you wod want to relax. First the carpet was badly stained the matresses were terrible uncomfortable. My fiancÃ© sat in the chair and when he got up he had all kinds of dust all over him. The bathroom was okay but part of the bathroom door had looked like someone kicked it and a corner of the inner door was unpainted and looked like it had not been repaired. Oh also the actual door to the room had a trick to shutting it you had to pull and slam very ghetto. Next our tv remote did not work we called and they said someone would be right out but Boone showed up until an hour n half later. The wifi connection was slow and overall our stay was terrible the only nice person we encountered was the bar tender but the bar that was supposed to be open until two closed at ten go figure.

Reviews.Title: “Place is Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: nightmare78
Reviews.Content: This place was unbelievable. It is close to everything. We ended up golfing for 6 days. The food is amazing and the staff is so polite and caters to your every needs. Highly reccomended!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE !!!”
Reviews.Author: photographybuff
Reviews.Content: We checked into our first "non-smoking room" to be hit by a wall of old cigarette smoke. We called the front desk and asked to be moved to another room and they said ok. They moved us to room 801...we soon found out this room had a possessed toilet. It would flush on it's own. We had the maintenence man there 2 or 3 times and it would be quiet for a few minutes but then it would start to flush on its own again...very creepy !!!!!! We then asked the desk to move us again and they moved us two doors down-no possessed toilet but the bathroom needs some serious help !!! There were 4 ice machines on the property and after the first night, not one of them worked. We ended up getting ice from the bar or the attached restaurant. The one good thing I will say is the restaurant staff were very helpful and friendly. They also had good food at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Toad Hole”
Reviews.Author: GogetterVancouver
Reviews.Content: Despite its name, this place is no resort. Far from it. Too close to the freeway/noise, lots of exhaust grime everywhere because of it. Rooms are old and smelly, same as the reception lounge. Smelled somewhat like an old trailer. Ugh! Walls dirty, grimy, and in desperate need of new paint. Bed comfy enough, however, the towels are like sandpaper, so watch out! They advertise the pools as being heated ones. Well, guess what? They're not.

Reviews.Title: “Great pricing, excellent location, and wonderful customer service.”
Reviews.Author: lizzzzzzz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times, with my most recent visit lasting 3 days. Staff are friendly and helpful, rooms are clean and pricing is excellent. Located in what I consider the heart of San Diego, and is close to every area (mission & fashion valley malls, downtown, beaches, etc.) I would definitely stay here and again, and look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this disease!!”
Reviews.Author: Moond
Reviews.Content: When we opened the door we were greeted by the lovely smell of mold and dust. The carpet was in bunches and had huge disgusting spots all over. The bathroom sink was literally falling off the wall!! I was nervous staying here with my family. The first night was horrible for many reasons. One: the smell. It was horrid. Two: the 10:00 curfew only applied to guests. Local teens and bar hoppers were allowed to party till 4. Three: we were right next to the ice machine and people needed ice at 3 am keeping us awake. The second day I attempted to find another hotel but many were booked full. My wife went to go check us out of this nightmare when I was out looking for better hotels. They offered to upgrade us to a better room at no cost. We accepted. Room 2 gave my three year old a rash on her face when she laid down in the chair!! The towels had hairs all over them and it was still run down. Plus we couldn't use the hot tub due to it being filled with drunken teens. The little mini mart was nice during the day at night its a different story. We went in to get ice cream and a young lady offered to give me oral if I bought her a bottle of booze, I had my 5 year old daughter with me!! I could not believe it! I told the front desk and they told me she is always there on Tuesday nights. They didn't even care!! This is a shady and dingy hotel! This place is horrible for families. I wouldn't recommend it to my enemies!! DO NOT STAY here!! It should be condemned!!

Reviews.Title: “Would work for short stay”
Reviews.Author: scaddenkim
Reviews.Content: I booked a vacation to southern California and decided to stay at Mission Valley Resort while in San Diego for four nights (2/12 - 2/16). I did find some things were OK at this hotel (free coffee and hot tea in lobby) along with the newspaper. The workout facility was awesome (take your room key and ID) as that was free too. I would not stay for more than one night again as I feel the room was too small for myself and 19 year old son. Location was awesome as far as close to Sea World, zoo and beaches but I would personally try someplace else and would opt for a 2 1/2 star in hopes of a nicer room. It certainly wasn't the worst hotel. We kept the do not disturb on our door the entire time however the last day they entered anyway which I did not like. Free hi speed internet did not work in our room unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “exactly what you see,and more,very personal service,very clean!!”
Reviews.Author: lookingforhappines09
Reviews.Content: six of us went to celebrate our daughters birthday and the counter agent raul greeted us and i had a small problem with my rez on line but he helped me to solve it.And he was also very helpful about where to go out for entertainment he really went out of his way to make sure we were taken care of. we were tired and he also let us know of the resturant that is attatched and the sport bar to watch the supper bowl.The rooms were very clean and the area was clean and quiet,its a very nice place to stay i highly recommed it to anyone,you will not be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Traveler beware - this is not a resort”
Reviews.Author: sadday
Reviews.Content: Arrived late at night. Had difficulty finding the lobby. After about 20 minutes got checked into our room, which was also a challenge to find. Walked into the room and immediately the word bedbugs came to mind. The bedspreads were "frumpy" like someone had already laid down on them. I turned the heater on (a wall unit under the window). The grating was gone and the dust was thick on the unit. The dust smell immediately was everywhere in the room. The carpeting was buckled and very worn. The bathroom fan light was extremely noisy. Nothing felt or looked clean. When we went back to the lobby to tell them the room was unacceptable they offered us an upgrade to a cleaner nicer room. We declined - by then our trust was gone. We questioned why we were not given at better room at first. I can understand why they never refund your money within 24 hours of your visit. That is the only way they can insure income coming in.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great price, terrific location if you're shopping at fashion valley”
Reviews.Author: Rosalbacg87
Reviews.Content: We stay in this hotel everytime we go to san diego, since we go there mostly for shopping, it's great for the value. It's perfect for the family, and you can park your car right in front of your room!! Which is perfect for loading AND unloading all those shopping bags... A great plus is the gym, the laundry! Which is traditional coins and allows you to take home no dirty business.. The valley kitchen is great for breakfast.. Overall it's the closest to feeling like home, I would advice you to get the better rooms though.. They're bigger, closer to the pool and not so expensive..

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Winrow1
Reviews.Content: My local favorite when visiting family in San Diego, which makes for a nice home away from home, whether for the night or week.Â  This is one of the last of the classic resorts in the hotel circle. Itâ€™s consistently clean, comfortable, quiet, friendly, reasonable and has everything I could ask for on-site with the internet, fitness center, tennis, racquet ball, pools, sports bar, mini market, etc. as well as shopping just a three wood away.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible room; Worst customer service ever”
Reviews.Author: Steve_Green
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst and most unfriendly place Iâ€™ve ever stayed at. --Called ahead on the day of check-in to let them know I might not get there till after midnight. The desk clerk tried to tell me they might have to give away my room if I didnâ€™t arrive before midnight! Huh? This was a fully prepaid room, for 5 nights! --Arrived right around midnight. Sullen desk clerk asked for picture ID as usual, and I gave him my drivers license, which had the date punched out as it was about to expire and my new license was being mailed to me. He told me I couldnâ€™t use it as an ID. I pointed out that it was still a picture ID that showed that it was indeed me, that it was currently my only picture ID, and that my reservation was prepaid anyway. He said he didnâ€™t care, and I couldnâ€™t check in with that ID. I started to get mad and told him to call his boss â€“ he backed off, told me to calm down (!) and accepted it as ID. Interesting that a BANK accepted the license as ID with no questions a couple of days later. --Got to my assigned room, which had a giant refrigerator truck noisily idling right outside the room -- I guess the driver had to keep it running all night so the food wouldnâ€™t spoil. So I went back to the front desk, and told the clerk I needed a different, quieter room. He told me there were only two available. Clearly a lie, since judging from the parking lot the place was obviously only about 10% full. Anyway, one of the rooms he offered was in back and quieter, so I took it. --On to the room: Moldy, marginally clean bathroom with peeling wallpaper and low-pressure shower; aging filthy carpet, sagging mattress, spiderwebs in the ceiling corners, missing TV remote â€“ a generally nasty room. In all fairness, the grounds were nicely landscaped and there didnâ€™t seem to be any bedbugs in the room. --Found myself locked out of the room phone, even though I had used a credit card for incidentals when checking in. Had to call front desk to fix. --Was greeted by a sign in the bathroom that said, in so many words, If you steal our towels, we'll be glad to bill you for them. The "towels" were thin, small, and scratchy. --Second day there, while on my way to my room, a prostitute popped out of a nearby room and solicited me. Very classy. The â€œresortâ€� was pretty noisy, with lots of coming and going at all hours. Gee, I wonder what would account for that? When I checked in I had to initial a line on the check-in sheet that said something about zero tolerance for parties, you will be required to leave, etc. I guess prostitution is a different kind of party. This room was pretty cheap -- $60 per night, but Iâ€™ve stayed in much nicer rooms in San Diego through an online booking service for $40 or less per night. Just Say No to Mission Valley Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort at a great value”
Reviews.Author: RADN
Reviews.Content: Lets be honest people! This is isnt the ritz carlton, but it is a great find for the budget concious. My girlfriend and I wanted to have a quick getaway to socal but were strapped for cash. We found an amazing weekend rate online. The rooms are spacious and new and clean. The decor in the rooms is a little dates but its super clean so who cares when your saving money. They also have two swimming pools on site. The sleeper of this hotel is the restaraunt....OMG, to die for. Good down home country cooking that tastes home made. NO freezer food!!! make sure to check out the blue plate specials!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Mission Valley Resort was a pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: KimmieTK
Reviews.Content: Traveling from the mid west all the way to San Diego can be very stressful....especially for our family. After our long journey, it was such a pleasure to arrive at the Mission Valley Resort. The staff was courteous and friendly, the room was clean and pretty! Nothing is more frustrating than ordering a non-smoking room only to enter one that has obviously been smoked in. At Mission Valley, the room smelled and looked clean. The location was also great...easy access to all the local sites we were interested in seeing. The staff was extremely helpful in assisting us coordinate our daily sightseeing....next time we visit San Diego, we'll be staying at Mission Valley Resort again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lobby looks wonderful....don't be fooled.”
Reviews.Author: Caroleeluberto
Reviews.Content: This "resort" is the worst dump ever. The staff are very VERY VERY noisy in the morning yelling out to each other with no regard to the guests. I wanted to cancel the second night but couldn't get my money back from hotels.com. They lost us as customers and we wouldn't stay at Mission Valley "Resort" if THEY paid US!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't book here”
Reviews.Author: marcosam72
Reviews.Content: Hi, only to comment to not book here, it was the worse experience ever, rooms are old, no very well maintenance, carpet was filthy and smelly.... and the worse part was when I checked my bank statement there where two separate charges from the hotel, so I have to call them to haven fix... :( :( :( :(

Reviews.Title: “best secret !”
Reviews.Author: AnissaS
Reviews.Content: the hotel was located in great area ! WE CAME TO GO TO LEGO LAND ! We were a 20 min drive from here 10 mins from airport .has 2 pools resturant on prem.(good food) conveint store (prices good) . we saw bad reviews after we booked and were scared to death but after we got here and checked in we are thrilled we were here....... It is not a 5 star hotel but for a budget family trip it had every thing we needed !

Reviews.Title: “Dont book it”
Reviews.Author: zman01
Reviews.Content: I booked the room becouse my sister was having her wedding there and everone was staying there i got to my first room carpet riped and stained all over room smelt like mold ,the second room smelled horible (smokers in it for years) walls all marked up ,3rd room i just settled on only problems of that one were the doors fell of from time to time and i just put up with it for my sisters sake . one of the worst hotels i ever stayed in

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Adventure, Willetts England”
Reviews.Author: WirralAngel
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Mission Valley at the end of june this year. We booked it 3 weeks prior to going as we had just found out I was pregnant with our first child and we needed a holiday before the baby arrives. Apparently they suffer (JUNE GLOOM) obviously throughout june, however only 2 out of our 11 days was over cast, the rest was beautiful and very warm no complaints there, we found this hotel to be really pleasant, the pool and jacuzzi where both lovely (very quiet) and clean, our room was comfortable with a large bed ,tv,phone,bathroom all that you need really its not the hilton but I am not a hilton type of person I like a relaxed clean hotel with friendly staff. We had a few drinks most nights in the hotel bar before we headed off to bed, the bar staff were great, very motivated, and friendly. We did so much on our holiday Sea world (amazing) returned there 2 more times, San Diego zoo, USS Midway, Seaport Village, Old Town, Point Loma, the list is long. This type of holiday was very different to our usual yearly visit to the Caribbean we were on the go all of the time I did get a bit tired with being pregnant but I was not going to the caribbean and risking the food etc!! I think San Diego is a beautiful city but you will need another holiday to get over all the site seeing and flights.

Reviews.Title: “Not a resort!”
Reviews.Author: Disappointed12345
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Mission Valley Resort and had booked this on-line for 5 nights. Just before we left, I had checked out some other travel reviews and was very nervous once reading many of them. However, I kept an open mind and we arrived on the 17th. Prior to leaving, I had called our travel agent and she had called the resort. They promised her that they would give us one of their "softly renovated rooms." When we arrived, we were told that we were poolside, so we headed to our room to check it out. When we opened the door and took a look around, we were SO disappointed! Softly renovated meant that the furniture had dints and gouges out of it, the walls had been painted over gouges and pieces of it missing, the electrical sockets weren't even attached to the wall, the bathroom was old, and the tub dingy. The bath mats were gray each day and twice we had "fresh" towels put in our bathroom that had hair on them---not ours! The bathroom tiles had pieces missing out of them, and had been painted over to cover all of the chip marks----not even in matching paint. The air conditioner worked, but didn't keep the room at an even temperature. The one-pane sliding windows had no screen-----everything but the toilet was old! You could hear our neighbours through the walls at all times of the evening/night. The door had no weather stripping on it at all, didn't close properly and as a result you could hear everything that was going on outside. The chair looked like something that most people would have thrown out! We were disappointed enough to be willing to lose our money that had been paid early in the spring and move to another hotel, but unfortunately, didn't find one available for the time we needed----most were booked. We will NEVER stay here again!! It was a great location for getting to all the tourist sights, however, there are many other hotels on that same street that would be much better and more comfortable. Very disappointing!!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, filthy, filthy!”
Reviews.Author: mingmama
Reviews.Content: Made our reservations online, saw pictures of what to be a very nice place! It was going to be over $200.00 a night so we figured it must be a decent place. What a load of hooey! We went to the reservation desk and checked in, drove to our room, walked up the sidewalk and immediately saw dirty walls and a dirty door. Opened up the door and again immediately saw a filthy chair. The room reeked of mold, the windows were opened to mask this I assume, and the bedspreads and carpet were filthy! The bathroom was peeling paint and had a dirty tub. Not 10 minutes later we checked out. The word "resort" should never be used with this place as it is a motel dump! Luckily, we called the Hampton Inn up the road and they had a nice clean room for us. After telling them our problems they even gave us a cut on their price of $300 for weekends (ComicCon was happening that weekend). They were so nice to us and had free breakfast every morning!

Reviews.Title: “Please do not stay here.....don't believe any positive reviews of this dump!!”
Reviews.Author: Rolfzilla
Reviews.Content: I booked this 'hotel' while on holiday in LA this year. I had read the reviews and as there were mixed reviews I thought it probably was just because people were too choosy....I was wrong. This place is a dump. I had booked originally for 2 nights but cancelled the second night as soon as we got there. We were supposed to have a 'superior' room. We were given room 805, which was substandard at best. The room was smelly, it was dirty and the bathroom was disgusting. I picked up the phone to call reception and the inside of the handset was black with dirt. I could not hold the phone so I hung up while the guy said he would check if there were other rooms available. I got to the reception before he did anything. We were given a 'newly decorated room' according to the reception.....not. The second room was a bit bigger but the same old and tired dÃ©cor. The beds were uncomfortable and creaked every time you moved, so none of us got much sleep. My sons went for a swim and said the pool was ok but while they were in the jacuzzi some people came alone with drink (which is I think the third pool they refer to on their website). If you don't mind you children being subjected to that this is the place for you! Myself and my wife decided the only way to stay in this dump would be slightly numbed with a few drinks. In the list of facilities it indicates there is a sports bar, so we went to have a few drinks and a game of pool. The bar was full of local people having a pool tournament, so I ask you can the hotel honestly say that this is a guest facility if guests are not able to get access. I complained to a manager about the supposed-to-be-hotel, I needed to get it off my chest. The lady said she would follow it up and call me in the next day........that did not happen. The next night we checked into the Porto Vista....I would recommend staying there. The bottom line is never ever stay at the Mission Valley Resort, sleeping in your car would be a better option.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: awright517
Reviews.Content: It's definitely a no frills place and I'm not sure why it's called a resort. Maybe because it's spread out among 12 acres, I don't know. They don't have any facilities that would qualify it as a resort. There are 2 outdoor pools, 1 jacuzzi, and 1 indoor lap pool, sauna, and a fitness facility. We stayed in a standard room with 2 double beds and it was the size of a shoe box. The beds were super uncomfortable and the linens were paper thin - nothing plush about them. The bathroom was very small, the shower drain in the room didn't work well at all, by the time you got done showering there was enough water in the tub to sit down and take a bath!! The wallpaper was peeling off the walls in both the bathroom and the bedroom. The rooms are in need of a major refurb!! There's a restaurant onsite, although I'd compare it more to a diner. It too is in need of a major refurb. Some of the booth seats had tape on them covering holes in them. The food was just okay. There is a convenience store onsite as well, which is nice, but FYI the standard rooms don't have a fridge or microwave so be prepared to have something to keep stuff in, i.e. cooler if you buy soda's, etc. from the store to have in room. The rate was good, we paid $81 a night so it could have been worst. The property is pet friendly which is a plus. They charged a $35 one time pet cleaning fee. There's an ATM right outside the property and a bus stop right outside that will take you to the Fashion Valley Transit Station where you can catch the trolley or a connecting bus to travel through out the city so it is conveniently located. The lobby provides a computer for guest use free of charge and we were given an early check in and late check out.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property -- in urgent need of room update/maintenance”
Reviews.Author: mike110742
Reviews.Content: [Note to Priceline & other third-party guests] Like everyone else, 3rd-party customers read reviews and arrive with expectations; high attentiveness to guest needs is what distinguishes one 2-3 star from others. Third-party prices fill rooms, and provide the business with opportunities to sell services and win future customers. My advice to Priceline customers: pay attention to reviews, articulate your needs clearly (both in advance and on arrival) and speak directly and immediately to management if your expectations are not met. If basic room needs are unmet and you bought from Priceline, tell Priceline in writing; use snail mail to the companyâ€™s street address and direct to Customer Service VP. Iâ€™ve found them responsive. Talk to local management directly and pleasantly: they value meaningful guest feedback and often can use information you provide to correct persistent problems. Be courteous and civil to a fault: it never helps to be confrontational.] Very economical for me for one week on Priceline, this hotel is on an exceptionally beautiful large footprint in Mission Valley, located on the service road just S of the I-8, improbably named â€œHotel Circle North.â€� Rooms are basic and dark, my room much too small for the enormous heavy furniture that populated it. My â€œkingâ€� room barely contained a king bed, a huge TV cabinet-dresser-closet, a huge easy chair, crumbling plaster around the old temperature control unit, and a spare desk/chair. Movement from one part of the room to another required moving furniture. Email asking for a refrigerator at check in was answered by telling me I should not have booked thru Priceline, and my request was forwarded to a front-desk supervisor who never answered it. (I gave u email and just asked for the refrig at check in.) There was no TV remote; it was later replaced. The ancient heating-cooling system didnâ€™t respond, and was eventually replaced with a new one. The personnel involved with me were terrific, of particular note the housekeeper (who I tipped generously, twice) and a night maintenance person who cheerfully replaced the AC unit. BIG PLUSSES: Ample free parking, flawless WI-FI, a beautifully-landscaped premises and pools, a self-service laundry on the property, free local and 800-calls, computer with printer near front desk. NEED HELP: outdated decor, bedding just OK, space much too small for oversized furniture, very thin walls and night noise from other guests, and severe attitude from a front-desk person who declined (in a pretty absolute manner) to find me another room (hotel was overbooked) when the AC system started heating the room at 11 PM one night. (The hotel does, however, have cooperative relationships with other area properties to care for guests who find themselves bumped or in awkward situations, when an environmental problem (like a non-working AC) means a guest need canâ€™t be properly met.) A local pizza company stuffs fliers noisily into the room each afternoon, in violation of hotel policy; and apparently calls to it from hotel rooms are blocked!) The on-premise restaurant serves basic but fresh American food staples, generously portioned, lots of specials, pleasant servers. Hotels in this area are close to everything, downtown/Balboa Park/Hillcrest is 3 miles. Local drivers, who will cross three freeway lanes at 60 mph to an exit ramp, are frightening. Because the area is so densely populated by freeways and on-ramps, finding businesses can be tricky even with a GPS. Allow time; drive at non-commute times if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth staying at this so called resort....”
Reviews.Author: diam0nd77
Reviews.Content: Don't believe what you see on the pictures online they are fake, promised queen beds got full beds instead, rooms dirty, bathroom moldy, carpets are disgusting......Stay some where else.....

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother! Yuck!”
Reviews.Author: tiki-t
Reviews.Content: The room that we were given was the worst that I have experienced in my travels. Even though it is non-smoking, there was a strong smell of smoke and stale alcohol, like a dirty bar. The smell was even in the bedding!The carpet looked filthy and the room is in desperate need of renovations. The walls were paper thin. Our next door neighbors were screaming at each other at 2 am. A call to the front remedied the situation after security paid the room a visit. That is the only positive thing that I can say about this place. I probably should have seen what other rooms that they had available but we got in late and were only here for one night. I am never staying here again. Motel 6 would have been a HUGE upgrade from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, staff was excellent”
Reviews.Author: kijay13
Reviews.Content: Got this room off of Hotwire in an emergency situation after a total nightmare happened at the La Mesa Travelodge earlier in the night. It was a nice change to deal with pleasant, professional and efficient staff after having been subjected to the rudest, most unprofessional front desk clerk I have ever encountered at the La Mesa Travelodge (I did a review of that place, not sure if Tripadvisor is posting it or not, trust me that place is a horrible place). The room was older, but very clean and very comfortable. We were only there overnight, so did not get a chance to use any of the recreation activities that they mentioned too us. We will go back in July and stay at this location, as the location was great and so was the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for your money”
Reviews.Author: AudieCerezo
Reviews.Content: Eventhough the resort is older than the ones around, the staff has been very friendly. They offer their help with a friendly smile. The rooms were spaceous and quiet. the kids love the pool, shuffle board, and the fitness center. I would stay here the next time we come down to this area. The diner located at the resort is very good too. Breakfast was hot, fast, and tastey. I would eat there again. Even the servers were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good pool and got good room service.”
Reviews.Author: g00dfamily
Reviews.Content: The Location and Value all right, kids like the Pool We had a good time at the resort

Reviews.Title: “No "Resort", What a Dive!!!”
Reviews.Author: pruettbad
Reviews.Content: Pimps, Prostitution and possible Drug Dealers! Stayed at this "Resort" for a week and needed to be moved 3 times during that week. Two rooms down, the police showed up three times in one day. Would have moved to another hotel in a heart beat but was with a large group of people. Shady people stay at this hotel because of the price. Rooms are dark, smell of smoke even if you have a non-smoking room. Wall plugs didn't work. Wouldn't walk on floors in bare feet. One computer that never worked the entire time that I was there, good thing I brought my own. Will never stay again under any conditions. Total renavation is needed on this so called "Resort"!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: svcollins15
Reviews.Content: I recently went on vacation with my family to San Diego. The Mission Vally Resort far exceeded my expectations. The staff were extremely friendly and the rooms were exceptionally clean, not to mention it was very easy to get everywhere we wanted to go! I would definately reccemmend it to famalies that are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service and mold in the room”
Reviews.Author: DeebertSantaCruz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business trip. The Service was terrible and very disorganized. The hotel charged my credit card twice for the nights that I stayed there. When I called to fix this problem, it took days for someone to respond to me. There was mold growing on the walls of the bathroom and the toilet did not work. I continually called the front desk to get the toilet fixed but to no avail. I was there for 2 nights. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone. There are MANY other hotels along the same road that would likely be better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Aren't there rules against calling a motel a resort?”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler619
Reviews.Content: In San Diego Hotel circle is about as vanilla a location as you can find. Mission Valley is centrally located meaning it is equally far from any points of interest. The "Mission Valley Resort" motel has to be one of the worst hotels on the circle. The dingy dirty motel rooms smell like stale cigarette smoke and the frequently cycling loud broken air conditioning unit attempts to drown out the freeway noise. I saw a prostitute in the parking lot. How this motel calls itself a "resort" and earned three stars is beyond me. If you are looking for meager accomodations the motel 6 across the way is recently renovated and much safer and nicer and most likely cheaper. There are a number of hotels on hotel circle fitting any budget but I would not recommend the mission valley resort to anyone not seeking their inner Bukowski.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible in every catagory”
Reviews.Author: CiciOakland
Reviews.Content: I have attended four professional conferences here and after the first stay at this hotel, I chose to stay elsewhere in hotel circle during the conference. The rooms were small, outdated, unclean and our conference goers were plagued with loud, uncontrolled parties until 3am. People ran up and down the halls, banged on our doors and there were hookers hanging around the parking lot! The staff was rude and unreceptive to our ongoing complaints about all of these topics. I paid about $40 less per night with a huge room and free hot breakfast at Hawthorne Suites.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Party Venue Ever!”
Reviews.Author: BronxgirlSanDiego_CA
Reviews.Content: We just had a huge birthday party at the Mission Valley Resort in San Diego, CA. We rented the upstairs ballroom/party room venue for our big bash. The hotel services could not be beat. This was a 65th party with 65 people, a dj and a dance instructor (line dancing!). The hotel gave us the best possible "dance floor space" by adding flooring to the floor, thus giving us more room for our line dancing. They also set up the tables and decorated for me exactly the way I asked. In addition all lthe food was catered through the hotel itself. Everyone raved about the appetizers (barbecued meatballs & stuffed mushrooms) in addition to the fabulous food items on the buffet. The hotel wine was excellent. The staff did a great job in accomodating us in whatever I requested - for a great price! It is a convenient venue for everyone - right in the heart of the hotel district in San Diego. Thank you Anne Marie/Traci, Justin and everyone who took my calls and helped get me thru planning the best party ever and the best place to hold it!

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: far0ut
Reviews.Content: I would like to recommend Mission Valley Resort. My boyfriend and I stayed there last year and we had a very lovely vacation thanks to it. Luckily we found it in Easy Click Travel for a very fair price. It looked tempting but in reality it was much better :) I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay!”
Reviews.Author: love2travel2531
Reviews.Content: I did not like this hotel at all! we checked in and the first room was very dark and cramped. Had to many doors to enter the room and the bed was broken. After telling the front desk they argued that the bed was fine when it clearly wasn't. They reluctantly moved us to another room which was worse than the first! I felt very unsafe and will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with stay”
Reviews.Author: O8B_WTC
Reviews.Content: Gail, Just wanted to send some feedback on a recent stay at Mission Valley Resort. We were in San Diego on business, and from the pictures and everything that was advertised as included with the room, expected to have a normal, enjoyable, and successful stay in San Diego, as we should expect at Mission Valley Resort. A few observations to report: 1) The room was messy when we first entered, and had more than a few solicitor's flyers inside on the floor. 2) The smoke detector was inoperable when we entered the room, due to a bad battery, and we listened to it beep. This was fixed the next day but we had to deal with it ourselves the first night. 3) Being on business, we expected to be able to use the free wifi service and connect to the internet during our stay. I was not successful in connecting to the service because I could find no wifi point that was being broadcast by Mission Valley Resort. I called to the desk for assistance, and got the impression the person at the desk neither knew what I needed nor cared to be of much help. We got through 2 nights at Mission Valley Resort and decided to move elsewhere so we could get what we needed during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Value”
Reviews.Author: Ralph31
Reviews.Content: I recently concluded a three day stay at the Mission Valley Resort and was pleasantly surprised. Undoubtedly, there are other hotels in San Diego that offer more plush and spacious accommodations but at substantially higher prices. But what really sets this place apart is its array of facilities. The restaurant's 60's coffee shop motif belies the well prepared and very fresh food. It's conference facilities are comfortable, varied and ably managed by very accommodating folks. Even the sports bar is better than one might expect. Access to a very comprehensive fitness center, two pools, golf and lots of shopping within walking distance....Now, on a limitless budget, given a choice I'll choose La Costa. But with a limited budget for a conference or vacation, I cannot imagine a better place than this.

Reviews.Title: “The term "resort" is laughable when used for this place”
Reviews.Author: lanavictoria
Reviews.Content: I rate this room 2 Â½ out of 5- Nothing really great about the room, but if you just need a place to sleep, nothing really bad. In looking back, I would say that this is more on an low budget extended stay hotel rather than a resort. The other reviews are right it isn't the Omni but neither is it quite a Hotel 6. Hotel tax is 12.5%. But 1.5% is for their marketing. Nice that you get to pay for thier lie. We booked our room on the web site as a pre-paid 14 day advance purchase . We booked the SUPIERIER double bed, at 56.00 per night. We stayed in room 251. When we arrived - very tired from our drive - I was told that "somehow they had forgotten to charge my room to my credit card, but "don't worry ,I would pay the price I had been given" They were correct, I was - plus 3 charges at .50 ea for local phone to order take out. In this day and age, who practices this? (Especially if you are calling yourself a resort) The hotel offers FREE internet yet they charge for a local phone call? The front desk staff was nice but not overly so. ( too busy talking to whomever was behind the wall) At least they were engaged n the conversation and did a good job telling us about the bus and the internet in the lobby. (you get 15 min.) This must be thier "Business Center" I wouldn't do any of my business 2 steps away from the check-in desk. The maid came knocking on our door at 9 am and then she just let herself in when I didnâ€™t immediately answer. Check out is not at 9. Unless a room has been checked out of there is no reason for maid service to just open my door. It would have been nice if the front desk staff would have said something or that there was some kind of notification in the room that a maid would be by that early. I exchanged our towels and asked for more coffee for the next day â€“ she happily took care of my needs. But she did want to come in to clean â€“ We were a 3 day stay, I donâ€™t like people in my room while my things are there. The room is fairly large, nicely appointed. The coffee pot is an actual pot with ceramic mugs not paper cups. That was nice. It made 4 cups. The hairdryer actually worked. They do have a safe and a nice size closet. However, that's about it. The room shown on their webpage was not the room we were given, an unnecessary bait-and-switch. Attempts had been made to upgrade the room. Granite tops for the nightstand, desk and coffee area. Newly upholstered and appointed bed, beds were far from large. A full size is not large. The TV remote worked about half the time. Private balcony overlooking the 1940-1950â€™s style courtyard was nice, table and chairs were plastic with cigarette burn holes and definite rot on the boards â€“ although they did try to paint over it. We had a spider crawl across us the first night in our bed. Lovely. As to cleanliness: The items that touch a personâ€™s skin were clean. However, the carpet edges had never seen a crevice tool, the edges in the bathroom the same. The walls in the bathroom had several hand prints and foot prints on the wall paper and the door trim was grimy. I am a previous rental unit manger so I wet down a washcloth just to see how easily it came off. Plain water did the trick so I attribute the issue to poor management of the cleaning staff. Obviously the rooms are not inspected after they are â€œcleanedâ€� The upkeep of the entire hotel inside and out shows decay and rot. The wallpaper has been patched instead of replaced, the vaulted ceiling has been painted white over dark wood, and is now cracked and coming off in large pieces. At night you can see where all the other patchwork has taken place. They have a laundry, but the area is foul, both in upkeep and atmosphere. I didnâ€™t feel safe down there. 3 washers and 3 dryers â€“ cost is 2.00 per load there is not a bill changer so make sure you have quarters!! You will need to go to the convenience store/booze store (with that type of crowd) onsite and deal with their rudeness to purchase laundry soap. The bathroom is dismally small and in bad repair. It is all inclusive. The sink is in with the tub and toilet, very little counter space. The sink cabinet is melamine and is peeling. They do have Sauve shampoo and conditioner for your use. The tub does not hold water, the massaging shower head had one setting (if you tried to change it fell apart in your hand) , the coupling to attach the shower to the wall is coming off. But the pressure and temp were good. There is a sweet tattered note taped to the wall that states that if you should wish to take their thread bare scratchy towels they will happily charge you ( on that note, there is a LARGE sign at check-in that states that they will hold funds on your card for up to 72 days, so beware) This hotel is on Hotel Circle. There are SEVERAL other places to stay. I would recommend that you do. But as stated, make sure that you have a car. It's a pain. The one saving grace to the â€œresortâ€� is the on-site restaurant. (the other plus would have been the gas station, but it is closed â€“ you will have to go up I-8 to find one close) Very Friendly staff in the restaurant, attentive servers. They have a great Breakfast special at 6.99 with several choices and the Blue Plate Special at 7.99 that starts at 11 am and goes until they close â€“ there are other restaurants in the same area, all are in the other hotels. I canâ€™t rate the Bar or the Gym. We went to neither. But the Gym is up the hill and behind the hotel. It looks nice from below. They do have vending and Ice Machines. The pool is okay but much smaller than the one shown in the picture from the web. They do have a hot tub, my family told me that it was nice and warm, but after looking at the mediocre attempt at cleanliness in the room I opted out of the hot tub experience. Oh yes, the noice level. From everywhere but our next door neighbors who kept slamming the balcony door - very quiet. The lot was far from full, so we didn'i understand why we had people on both sides of us.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe what they tell you”
Reviews.Author: MAtraveler84
Reviews.Content: We specifically requested a non-smoking room. When we arrived at 10pm, we were given a room that reeked of tobacco. We were told that no other rooms were available, and that they could not guarantee a non-smoking room at any time. They sent up someone with a spray can to spray the room, which, of course, was worthless. This was our first and last visit.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: glynndak
Reviews.Content: Went to San Diego for the Monday NIght football game with a friend and needed a room.....got a room at the Mission Valley Resort and was very pleasantly surprised. This resort reminds me of the 50's. Think of a Drive up Motel where you can park your car right at your room, but add the resort style and what should be really expensive is relatively inexpensive. Everything is there...fitness club, gas station, 24 hour restaurant, convenience store, right in the heart of Mission Valley, courtsey shuttle bus, lots of lush greenery and a very friendly staff. Our room was quaint...meaning not huge, but what I would consider an average size room, 2 good size beds, clean and comfortable. I would definently stay at this Resort style hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Refused to stay at this terrible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sjloncari
Reviews.Content: The room was so bad we immediately checked out and found another hotel. Room was small, but the real problem was the black mold in the tub and walls of the bathroom. Very dated and in disrepair.

Reviews.Title: “Plush Grounds, Postage stamp room”
Reviews.Author: GlobalPassion
Reviews.Content: To be honest, this place was exactly what we needed. We wanted to spend time outdoors, and we just needed a place to lay our head on the pillow, as we were catching a morning flight. The grounds are beautiful! Expansive and green surrounding two pools. HOWEVER, the room was about as tight as you have ever experienced. We literally had to take turns turning around. There is just single file room to and from the bathroom. Even though there were two double beds, there is not room for three people. This is not a place to stay a week, just a quick night. in and out. But the price was good and the girl at the front desk was sweet

Reviews.Title: “overall good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KATAMEWAZA
Reviews.Content: I will start with the negatives, They would not let us check in before 3pm and that to me was inconvienent. With my bad kees standing in a long line to check in was a bear. Also when I got my room it was quite a distance ftom the amenities. That was the only real complaint I have. The good points are the amenities which is a fine restaurant on grounds and a pub with the friendliest bar tender I have yet to meet. The pool furrnised towels and the water was clean and the right temp. The only negative is they let parents take children in the Jacuzzi who were 2 yrs old and that is dangerous for the health of the child. The rooms were small but clean and modern. The maid who cleaned it on the second day was a real pro missing nothing and very fast and efficent. I gave her a few dollars for her hard work. The hotel is near freeway enterences that will take you everywhere. They have a flyer that tells you how to get to every sight in SD. They have a fired up computer in the office for our use if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: ChgotoCancun
Reviews.Content: We paid $35 a night for this place. The bed was comfy, as well as the overstuffed chair. The shower had great water pressure and was very hot. Very clean, as well. However, the rooms were small and very little shelf space in the bathroom. The pools were cute, but we didn't use them because of June Gloom. There was also a hot tub. If we were around, we would have used that! The bar was great! There was a happy hour and outdoor seating. A convenience/liquor store also on site. We parked right outside our room, so taking the luggage out of the car and getting it to room was just steps away. We drove 15 minutes to get to the Museum of Natural History to see the Bodies Exhibit (also wonderful!). We were less than 30 minutes from the beach. Again, couldn't use take advantage of beach activities because of the weather, but the shore was still beautiful. Afterward. we went next door to Albie's Beef and have a fantastic dinner. So, we just really used the room for sleeping and showering and both were great for $35. Lastly, the resort is huge but landscaped beautifully. What more could anyone want for the $$$ in San Diego in the Hotel Circle South??? If we come back to San Diego, we will be coming back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Property has it's apeal... Don't listen to negative people who have negative thoughts”
Reviews.Author: babaygirl78
Reviews.Content: Property is not a 6 star resort, but certainly has it's own appeal. With a resturaunt on property, convienence store which is open til midnight, a tavern (bar) with pool tables and wide screen television, not to mention....FREE USAGE OF FROGS GYM, 27000 Square foot health club. Who in their right mind would not want to stay there. I can honestly say that the rooms need some upgrades, but it's certainly not a motel 6. The staff there are wonderful. Very friendly and helpful. I would most definately return and stay there again. Room rates are affordable!!!!! Unfortunately the reviews are old and out dated as you can see.....So before you knock it you need to try this property at least once...Then give your opion.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Location without a car”
Reviews.Author: travelfanaticsUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mission Valley Resort for three nights after a cruise. It's OK - reasonable value for money. It's a traditional motel style resort which is rather tired and in need of renovation. The rooms are OK but quite small, especially by American standards. The pool area is quite scruffy and definitely needs some work. The restaurant there is good - especially for breakfast - with good value, well cooked meals and excellent service. Our main problem with the hotel is its location. It's on Hotel Circle and the only public transport is a bus that comes past every hour. You can get the bus to the tram station, and the trams are great. They run regularly (every 10-15 minutes depending on the line). You can use them to get to most of the areas you are likely to want to visit in San Diego. It cost $5 for a 1 day pass which you can use on both the trams and buses - a really good way to get around. We thought that the Holiday Inn On The Bay was in a much better location, being nearly on the waterfront and close to the tram line between Oldtown and Downtown

Reviews.Title: “Nope, NEVER again!”
Reviews.Author: MarineMom29
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a family hotel. It is dated and in need of major repairs. Our room smelled like musky paint fumes. When we changed rooms, one of the employees told us that they just painted the tubs in that building and told the management that they should not rent them two days so the paint could dry.
