As soon as the water hit the tub the room fumed up again. We couldn't air the room due to the ripped sceens and broken a/c. Aside of being outdated, the rooms weren't very clean. There were two pool areas and both were very clean and tidy. There are apartments on the hill above with quite the audience looking down on the hotel pools. (Not a relaxing feeling.) The "convenience store" listed is actually a liquor store and the bar has a questionable crowd hanging around. The diner needed a lot of updating and you could smell the grease from the parking lot. They had good deserts though and the gals were really nice and sociable. We arrived after 6pm and even though we guaranteed our rooms with a credit card, they still managed to give our rooms to someone else and we had to settle for different room types. (No apologies were extended.) There was one very helpful desk clerk and the rest didn't want to be bothered with anyone but the "friends" they were chatting with behind the desk. And forget about getting an accurate wake up call. Oh, did I mention some dingbat knocked over a fire hydrant and the parking lot was flooded and blocked off for 10 hours? This was an embarrassing choice of hotels for the guest we booked for. Nope, never in a million years would I ever stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Property and rooms needs some work.”
Reviews.Author: akabigj
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 451 at the Mission Valley Resort for 2 nights in October 08. We wanted to stay at a nice, lower priced ($99 night) hotel that was still kinda close to downtown. The staff were all friendly and helpful but the rooms and property are in need of some work. My room had the following issues: stained carpet and ceiling, extremely small bathroom and shower with peeling wallpaper and very dirty shelves, broken security latch on the inside of our door, and a TV that made a constant screeching noise when turned on. It seems like the owners have tried to improve the rooms with newer furniture and bedding but there is so many more improvements that need to be made. Most of the property and rooms are just simply old and beat up. We did enjoy the Valley Tavern on the property which served warm appetizers during it's daily Happy Hour starting at 4:00. Thursday they served Taquitos and Friday it was Calimari Rings so that was one of the few highlights. When we checked out we were charged a daily $1.11 Safe Warranty charge and a 2% Tourism Marketing Fee which was $1.98 a day. Seems like bogus charges to me but I wasn't in the mood to fight them on it, so I let it slide. We were not made aware of these charges when checking in either. Given it's present condition, I do not think I would stay at this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelz13
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst one I have ever stayed in. Many family members stayed here since we were attending a wedding that was held at the "resort". The room smelled like a boys locker room. It was dirty, the wallpaper was peeling, we had ants in the bathroom. The linen was very old and thin. Other family members had similar rooms. Several of us complained and were told if we didn't like it we could just leave. Unfortunately our rooms were already paid for. Do yourself a favor and stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Base”
Reviews.Author: lainey45
Reviews.Content: We arrived and checked in within 5 minutes. We had a large room with 2 queen beds opposite the swimming pool. I can recommend the hotels eating house the food was very good and a resonable price too. You deffinately need a car if you stay here. and would receommend the hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not Your Honeymoon Suite, BUT.....”
Reviews.Author: harry1104
Reviews.Content: This room wasn't great, but it wasn't bad either. The location and proximity to everything in San Diego is ideal. However, the rooms are in need of some serious upgrades. We try not to be too picky, the room served it's purpose (i.e. place to sleep and get ready for the next day) but if we hadn't got it for free it would not be a place I'd readily seek out and go back to. If you don't plan on spending a lot of time in the room, this place will work. Otherwise, I'd recommend somewhere else. I apologize that this review is very mixed, but that's kind of how this stay was. Take it for what it's worth......sweet dreams!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice but overrated”
Reviews.Author: elpasokid
Reviews.Content: well, what can I say that hasn't been said before. The room itself is okay but a bit small. any more than 2 people and it's very tight, very little space to move around and place luggage in the rooms. The hotel lists the beds as queen size but they're doubles so if you move around alot when you sleep, not much room there. Location to San Diego spots wasn't too bad, very easy to access the freeways. I do admit with other reviewers that the staff was excellent. When we needed extra towels they were promptly delivered to our room, even though it was in the evening and front staff were very helpful with directions and recommendations. My boys loved the pools and jacuzzi, which was nice. As long as you keep in mind that it's a basic hotel with not much frills and amenities and smaller rooms, then you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A DIVE!”
Reviews.Author: memberWestLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews (the honest one's, which means any that gave negative reviews) I was expecting this place to be a dive, and it is! Since we were here with a group and only staying for one night, I thought I'd give it a try. The first thing I noticed when I walked through the door was the musty, mildewy and "bug spray like" odor. The small window near the closet doesn't have any curtains so the bright sunlight penetrates into the room and on to the bed. If you like to take naps during the day, stay away from this place! The room is small, dirty and the bathroom is a joke. My husband just tried to get a tissue and the whole box came out of the wall. There is no bath mat for stepping out onto after the shower, there was hair from the previous patron on the sink. Yes, there is Bath and Body works toiletries, small and used.....can't they see it's been used and at least try to fill it to the rim? I don't normally walk barefoot in hotel rooms and this is one you definitely do not want to be without shoes or slippers...I do not even think I can take a shower barefoot! Granted, I knew going into this that this place would be a dive, but I just do not understand how any of the other reviewers can rave about how great this place is. If I ever have to return to San Diego I will stay at a Courtyard Marriott (which I see many of around here) or similar, at the very least. This place needs to be totally refurbished.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: MamaDebb
Reviews.Content: Where to begin. This is where I got ready for my wedding, had the reception, and where we stayed our wedding night. I was told that we would get a honeymoon suite and it would be ready for early check in, no problem. When I was called by the florist and told that she had no where to drop off the flowers, I called the front desk to ask them to let her in the room, only to find out I had no room! I was due to arrive in 30 min to get on my wedding dress, and no room! I was in tears, then out of no where they had a room (very unprofessional the way it was handled). All of the 15+ rooms we had reserved for guest were AWFUL. Dark rooms, broken furniture, thin walled, awful. Everyone complained and was eventually moved to the "better" rooms, with additional cost. Some members of the bridal party did not recieve the discount they were promised. Upon arrival for the reception, the contract stated that bride & groom were to be served and elderly family as well. No one wanted to do this or even help. I had to prove it was in the contract (and it was on their copy) before getting served our wedding meal!!! Tons of run around, chaos, unorganized, and they made for a not a very happy bride. Gave this place over $6,000.00 and got the crappiest treatment. I would NEVER suggest them for hotel stay or wedding venue. On top of that I never recieved a phone call or letter asking how everything went, as most all professional vendors do, so obviously they don't give a crap, and it wasn't worth my complaining to them, so here I am, hoping to help out anyone who is pondering a stay here! :( ~Bride Scorned

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Attentive Front Desk and Bell Hop!”
Reviews.Author: GoldsDowntownLA
Reviews.Content: After booking my room, I read some of the reviews and was up for an adventure. I didn't feel like staying at a chain hotel in Hotel Circle, and am glad that I found Mission Valley Resort. From the moment of my arrival on a business trip to San Diego, the warm and friendly welcome from Curtis and Ileana were very much appreciated. My room was ready, well maintained, and especially important -- quiet! It is a very peaceful and quiet place. The grounds are well maintained by these golf cart crews that quietly go about their buisness, with particular detail to keeping the grounds in immaculate condition. The pool was warm and perfect at the end of the day. I only ate at the restaurant once, but it is a great diner type restaurant where the staff too were very friendly, and a plus on the restaurant is that it is open 24 hours. Also, the women greeters at the restaurant were especially friendly and welcoming. Another plus was being able to work-out at the Frog's gym literally right up the hill from the hotel -- no need to drive, it was almost like walking out of your room and in 30 seconds you were at the gym, which too was well maintained and immaculate. The gym is a full-size gym, with tennis courts and a pool of its own as well! Mission Valley Resort is a great place to stay. As a result of this stay, I've reserved the rest of my summer's business trips here. The people working at the hotel, the grounds, the cleanliness, and the total experience was great. My stay was better than expected, and the value is great -- especially in San Diego. And special thanks to Curtis, Ileana, and Benny while I stayed at Mission Valley Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Dont”
Reviews.Author: jewellnmarin
Reviews.Content: Mission Valley Resort: Hotel Circle Drive, San Diego California I have seen this location many times, from the freeway and the pool looked inviting. In April, I was at a conference in San Diego, the weather was beautiful and I had time to visit with family. Knowing it had a pool and a resort feeling, and I had also, stayed at another property owned by the same company (I am very happy with the quality of that hotel). I went on line and got (what I thought at the time, was a good deal), the weekend rate of $105 per night for a double room. Your first sign should be the lobby and its tired decor. Although the staff was helpful and did try to accommodate my comfort. The old Hollywood feel of this "resort," is deceiving. I had requested a double room, quiet on the top floor. I was given a double room, below a two level freestanding building, with a bank of rooms on two levels. No elevators in this facility. As I drove up to the door (parking is outside your entry door) a young man, directly on the floor above, was sitting outside his room on the balcony walkway, drinking a can of beer. Not an encouraging sign for a Grandmother, hoping to spend time entertaining her family. The room was marginal at best, dinghy and dirty, the window was right next to the bed and the bathrooms were small and not very up to date. The 805 freeway borders this property, as convenient as that makes it for access, there is no escaping the noise, and there is freeway noise, but it was the idea of the young man upstairs with the beer, who encouraged me to ask for another room. I went back to the desk and was given (without question) another option, a handicap room with one bed, also facing the freeway on the first floor. This room was a single handicap, with a walk-in shower; it was not any cleaner and still very noisy, again with parking outside the door. Back to the lobby, for the third room. This room was a little away from the freeway and closer to the pool, a little larger, but the beds were still right next to the window, no parking in front, so that helped, but the noise was very apparent. At this point, I should have cut bait and run, but I was tired and with my Grandson, who wanted to swim, so we decided to try for at least one night. This room had a toilet that ran all night, and was necessary to jiggle the handle several times to stop it. The TV reception was fuzzy and not all the stations worked. Noise from the freeway went on all night, so I slept with earplugs. The pool was very nice, but the other clientele was young college students, who were smoking and drinking (I admit it was evening, before 10pm) and we did not stay to see if it was more family oriented the next day. They gave me no grief for early checkout and I then went to my local Marriott, which was a relief after my night in this "resort." I suggest you look for a better deal; this resort will not be your best bet.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: NorthBound98
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that normally I take most reviews with a "grain of salt" so to speak. I should have listened to the negative reviews on this site & stayed somewhere else. Let me also say that I have stayed at 5 star hotels and also Motel 6. This resort makes Motel 6 look like a 5 star hotel! My wife & I were in town for a charity event so I booked a room for 2 nights via the hotel website & checked in on 4/11/08. Upon entering the stuffy lobby, the absence of air conditioning is very apparent & was replaced by the sound of an electric fan. I started to wonder what type of establishment we were in when I was given directions to our room and told to turn right at the mini mart. Upon opening the door to the room we were immediately met with a strong musty smell. The feeling you get upon entering the room is that this is a place where you need to think twice about removing you shoes and walking around in your socks or bare feet. The carpet was wrinkled and old. The TV remote was sitting in a pile of crude on one of the night stands. The paint on the celing had seen its better days and was mostly peeling. The wallpaper had holes in it & was also peeling. The bathroom had hair on the ceiling above the shower. The bathroom vanity had also seen it's better days & was in sad shape. The bathroom light fixture was rusty & had 4 light bulbs - 2 of which worked. the bathroom was so small that if one person is using the toilet, no one else can enter the room. When I placed the phone book on the writing/ sitting desk, the phone book stuck to the top of the desk. We were forced to stay at this "resort" for one night as all of the other local hotels were sold out. First thing the next morning we checked out & found another hotel to stay at for the remainder of our trip. No one asked why we were checking out early & no one seemed to care. Had the room rate been $50.00 per night then this would have been a situation of "you get what you pay for". When you are paying $144.00 per night, I at least expect a clean room in decent shape. You have been warned. Don't say I didn't tell you NOT to stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “loved the palm trees”
Reviews.Author: neuhaus153
Reviews.Content: I would like to say thank you to all the staff at the hotel, It was a wonderful week. The service was great, we had everything and anything we needed. My room was facing the court yard and it was very nice, I just loved all the palm trees. And the rooms were very clean and nice. The room service was great. I would go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Generous Manager”
Reviews.Author: leparissa
Reviews.Content: the hotel manager was willing to upgrade our room without any additional cost, this was a blessing on our 1st year anniversary. Thanks again, Mr. Araya

Reviews.Title: “Mission Valley Resort is Pet Friendly”
Reviews.Author: imljt59
Reviews.Content: Ideally located in hotel circle, this hotel has really mastered what great customer satisfaction is all about. The last several times that my family has been there the cleanliness, the service, and the homey feeling has kept us returning to Mission Valley Resort. Pet friendly, but super clean and no odors leading guests to know this. There is one resident who makes this resort his home, it is easy to see why. If my son is accepted to the UCSD graduate program we would like to make this hotel his residence as well. A nice 24 hour coffee shop and a gas station and a liquort store are on the premises. Very convenient, and secure. A must stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overall-Great”
Reviews.Author: paintergal
Reviews.Content: I participated in a class there and even though the property IS dated, it is overall kept up & clean. The staff was just wonderful and accomodating in our requests for extra towels, late check-out, etc. The room rate was excellent compared to surrounding hotels. There is no charge for parking, which is convenient to the rooms and the restaurant on premises is excellent...they make there own homemade soups and sauces and except for the dated and somewhat shabby appearance of the place, the food is great and reasonably priced. Try the spanish omelet or the huevos rancheros- both really good. Restaurant is open 24 hours which was a big plus. Again, the "resort" is dated and although well maintained and clean, the place could use some sprucing up. Also note that as far as I could figure out there were not any elevators despite 2nd floor rooms and meeting rooms. The meeting room was upstairs which did pose a problem for some people. If you are looking for value, no frills type of place with a lot of convenience this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice and quiet. Restaruant was nice and staff was exceptional.”
Reviews.Author: Spoozer
Reviews.Content: I'd guess this resort was build before property got expensive as they have a lot of space and lots of old trees. It gave them enough space to keep it pretty quiet even though they were fairly close to the freeway. Easy acess. Close to Trader Joes and Fry's Electronics. Works for us! Office and Restaruant staff were personable. Not distant. Good. Food was good quality. Usual breakfast menu. There again staff was above average. We'd stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Mission Valley Resort Was Great!!”
Reviews.Author: sheronimo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mission Valley Resort for our honeymoon, and it was outstanding! The front desk service was top of the line and we found the room to be incredible! It was very spacious and clean. We found that we needed something brought to our room and it was brought within 5 minutes. The property is gorgeous and tropical which reminded us of Hawaii. Overall I would defintley recommend Mission Valley Resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “Some bad and some good.”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaWanderer
Reviews.Content: I asked my travel agent to book this resort based on the website (newbie) and only later read the reviews here. Although I was concerned by some of the negative reviews here, I thought I would wait it out and decide for myself. When we arrived, we were placed in a standard room which was dark, cramped, draughty and had thin walls because we could clearly hear the cell phone conversation of the gentleman outside our door. After complaining to the front desk, we were moved into a deluxe suite (free of charge) which somewhat resembled the picture on the website. It was roomier, brighter, warmer and surprisingly quiet considering the pool (clean, warm and full of fresh towels) was directly outside our door. Nevertheless, it had a small bathroom. To put it plainly, expect to have bruised knees if the door opens while you're sitting on the toilet. Also, the only towel rod for a room which sleeps 4 was broken so that the towels were sliding off one end. What turned my opinion around in the end was Lorraine's (staff member) willingness to go the extra mile for us. When we checked out, my 6 year old forgot his stuffy in the room. I contacted the resort when we arrived back in Canada and they found the stuffy, paid the shipping and it sent back to us. It arrived 2 weeks later. I would suggest that if you stay here, pay the extra and get the deluxe room.

Reviews.Title: “This year not quite as nice as last visit.”
Reviews.Author: robynrollins
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Mission Valley Resort. We were there Aug 18-21st. We had originally stayed here two years ago for a trip to SeaWorld and were very happy. We had a room by the pool and loved the on-site restaurant, pool, tavern, and mini-mart/liquor store. So we decided to go that route again and requested the same room when we booked personally over the phone and were told that it would not be a problem. Well, it was. We got the same type of room but at the end of the resort far from the pool and right next to their conference/ball room which had a reunion party one of the nights we were there. Very loud past midnight. They were unable to accommodate us and stated they do not guarantee specific rooms only room types. That was disappointing. However, that said, the food at the restaurant is still very good and the service prompt. The store on property is incredibly convenient. The rooms are adequate but note that the sink is in the bathroom so its harder for two people to get ready, although there is a vanity/desk with coffee maker outside the bathroom. There is room service here, convenient but of course slightly higher priced. The pool is nice and the bartender in the tavern will make you drinks in styrofoam cups to take to the pool. The laundry doesn't openuntil 9AM so that was a little late to do a quick load before hitting the sights. Very close to Seaworld, Mission Beach and lots of fun stuff though. All in all we will probably choose somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: sh619
Reviews.Content: Even though we booked a non-smoking room a month in advance we were given a smoking room our first night. The room the first night was tiny, dingy, and just gross. The next 6 nights we were upgraded to a large non-smoking room. It was nice but half the outlets didn't work and the bathtub kept clogging. We were pleased with our upgraded room but will never return. The main reason is the noise level. Our room was located next to their reception hall and they would book wedding receptions, etc without any regard for the paying guests not in the "party". So there was super loud music and partying going on until 1:00 am literally right outside our door even on weeknights!! Ridiculous!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Little Dump, Definitely Not A Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel808
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked this hotel for 6 nights at $159/night. What a rip off, I wouldn't have paid more than $75/night at peak conference season. Thank goodness that they let us check out after the first night. I was traveling with a group of 6 adults for a conference. One of our rooms smelled of smoke (non-smoking posted on door), so we asked to switch. All 3 rooms located in building 8 was a dump! How dare they call themselves a resort. Rooms had their own special odor, bathrooms were tiny, rooms seemed to close in on you, low ceilings and just plain dreary. Noise level was pretty high too. I don't understand how others could review this hotel as a 3 or higher...wonder what they consider poor conditions? The few positive things about this hotel was their policy on letting us check-out early, ample parking, and good location. If you can find a hotel anywhere else in hotel circle, I suggest you go there, you will be a lot happier. After checking out of the Mission Valley Resort, we checked into the Ramada...about the same price and way nicer. Front desk at Ramada was also very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KahunaKarl
Reviews.Content: My family and I have taken at least 2 San Diego Vacations every Summer for the past 12 years. We have stayed at many places including the Catamaran, the Bahia and Paradise Point. We were a little reluctant to stay at the Mission Valley Resort but our fears were put to rest shortly after our arrival. The Staff was very polite and when we requested a room change to allow us closer access to the pool area, it was done. The rooms however small, were clean and where we were located, was quiet. The Cafe on site had reasonable pricing and good quality, as well as a very friendly staff. We were very pleasantly surprised and plan on returning to stay at the Mission Valley Resort again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: allierskine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the mission valley resort with two friends in February of 2007, and we really enjoyed it! We were three 20 year old girls traveling alone however, there were no worries of being unsafe at this hotel. After reading reviews about this hotel, we actually intentionally got there three hours early, per thier cancellation policy, to check it out... just in case. We had the intention of decided whether it would be clean and safe enough, and finding another hotel if it did not meet our idea of "good." When we pulled off the freeway we spotted it, pulled in the parking lot and were suprised. The reviews we had read said it was "a dump..." NOT TRUE!!! Although it is an older hotel, it is very nice! Although we arrived too early to check in the people at the front desk allowed us to check in early @ no extra charge! The rooms were sufficient, especailly when you consider the price... the only dislike we had was the bathroom. Again let me remind you... THREE GIRLS... so obviously there was not enough counter space and the door didnt lock... but other than that I'm sure it would be fine for a couple or some less "high maitenance" group! Overall= VERY IMPRESSED!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: prosecutrix
Reviews.Content: We were traveling to San Diego to attend a function at the resort, and because we had a recuperating person in our party, we felt we needed to locate on site, and as close to the function as possible. We have stayed in Hyatts, Mariotts and Sheratons in San Diego in the past. When I read some of the online reviews, I expected a negative or neutral experience. Not so! Every effort was made to accommodate our special needs. The room was well-decorated and spotless. Beds were exceptionally comfortable(and I mean, without exception at any of the other sites where we have stayed recently ). While the beds were doubles and not queens, they were so comfortable that I would chose them any time. Also, the grounds were lovely, the staff was friendly, and the effort made to indentify the location of our event, the ambience of the setting for it, and the courtesy of the servers, bartenders and staff was way above average. All four adults in our party agree that this will be the base for our SanDiego visits.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Mindy53
Reviews.Content: We booked on-line; looking at the pictures and comments which don't always help. We were surprised to find a nice hotel in Hotel Circle S. for our 3 day stay. The rooms were clean, quiet but small. Any more than 2 of us, we would have been in trouble. The hotel is in a good location; easy to get to other locations and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: Gabby999
Reviews.Content: We just recently stayed at this "resort" What a dump the place was. If you are thinking of staying here, don't. I understand you get what you pay for , We stayed there as part of a so called free vacation we got when we bought a time share from a differerent company in December. We have friends in San Diego and thought it was a good idea. The hook was we had to attend a vacation time share thing. When we got there we all said out loud "this place is a resort?" Maybe in 1987, but not in 2007. It looks like 4 separate low rent motels sharing a parking lot. There was a pool and a spa/whirlpool . I've got bigger in my own back yard . The room was hardly bigger than a closet. Definitely not big enough for 2 let alone 3 people and their bags etc... There was a gap of about an inch at the bottom of the door that let in light, bugs and the recent cold weather. There was a window that opened to the view of a block wall complete with graffiti. The fan in the bathroom (which came on with the light) sounded like a jet engine. It was so loud that you couldn't hear normal speach when someone was in there. There weren't enough towels. It took well over an hour to get more even though we had a wonderfull view of the housekeeping building less than 50 feet away where several employees were just sitting around doing nothing. The liquoir store was well stocked ,but there were some scary types hanging around. Didn't try the restaurant

Reviews.Title: “I don't know what the fuss is about”
Reviews.Author: ginben
Reviews.Content: After booking 4 days at this place for 2 adults and 2 children, we had a look at the tripadvisor website. We were dreading staying there after reading such poor reviews. However our room (or should I say rooms) was spacious, had a fridge and microwave and was clean+++. We had access to the gym up the hill which was fantastic after not being able to swim for weeks. The pool on the resort, admittedly, was quite chilly and could have been a bit warmer, but the spa was just lovely! The staff were run off their feet, but were pleasant and more than helpful. The wireless internet was a Godsend for us, looking for accommodation in San Diego. The diner had the best food, and the staff were fantastic there. It was a little out of the way for getting around, but not impossible, and the buses are frequent. We were really happy staying here!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: ncalitravelboi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property on a couple of occasions for both work and pleasure. The room accomodations are uneven in quality, cleanliness and their need for updating. On one occasion, the room was clean and comfortable and at that time I felt it was a good value as it has a nice pool (the one nearer the front desk building has more features such as a spa, the farther pool has no spa), and the complementary gym pass was a plus. However, when I last stayed, the room was poorly maintained. The bathroom was especially poorly maintained with whatever material that was covering the original tile peeling off. There was also a black mildew in the caulking/grout and the tile floor was filthy looking. The beds were like boards and the second night, I couldn't sleep in them any longer as my back was killing me. Also, the room cleaning attendent knocked on the door at 8am on a weekend morning! So much for a leisurely morning. Additionally, the pool was padlocked for a couple of hours past the posted pool hours. It's very baffling how this resort can be so uneven in general condition. I would really think hard before making a reservation there as it seems like a roll of the dice as to whether you get a decent room or not.

Reviews.Title: “One word: Yuck”
Reviews.Author: silver68
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Mission Valley Resort for three nights on business. For the price we were charged for our room, I certainly expected better. Instead we got a small, musty smelling, damp room. We did have a king bed, but the pillows were small and it was poorly made-up. The heater-lamp in the bathroom would not turn off, and the hang-up button on the phone had to be "unstuck" every time I lifted the receiver. The walls were extremely thin and one night we were continually disturbed by a woman yelling at her crying child all night and on the other, by a boisterous late-night party. The hotel's internet site boasts free wireless internet through-out the resort, but I could only connect in the lobby area and by the pool. It would have been nice if the staff had mentioned the issue to me on check-in, thus sparing me the endless time on the phone to their wireless network technical support, seeking a non-existent solution. The staff was at best disinterested and at worst downright rude. Not one of them seemed even the slightest bit interested in making our stay pleasant. In fact, it would seem that we were an imposition to them because they actually had to do their jobs! The food at the hotel restaurant was overpriced and dreadful. It was just your typical every-day cuisine; how anyone could botch such simple fare is beyond me. In closing, you would do better to visit the local Motel 6 than to book a stay at Mission Valley Resort. It is in no way, shape, or form a resort, and the service provided is sub-par in every aspect.

Reviews.Title: “great price, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: azf4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights recently and the first room we were in could not get internet -- it was the furthest room from the main lobby. The reservations manager immediately gave us another room, no questions asked, and it was a much better and bigger room -- all at no extra charge. But I was at the front dest several more times and saw people come in with various concerns and each time, the person at the desk was amazingly patient and accomodating. We stayed here becasue it was one of the least expensive, but the room was very nice and the service was way above par.

Reviews.Title: “"Never Again"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel needs to change uts name because it is nowhere near a resort. The rooms and bathroom are very small, carpet was muggy and dirty. Shower curtain smelled like it had not been cleane. This place really needs some improvements. The staff just seemed like they did not care for the comforts of the guest, which I believe should be a priority. I will never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back”
Reviews.Author: phorse
Reviews.Content: This place was definitely not worth the money and I actually received a reduced rate for a conference! The walls are thin so you can hear everything from next door. I was also placed next door to a smoker even though they were all non-smoking rooms. Management said that there was nothing that they could do about it. Rooms were not very clean either. The plus is that there is wireless which works in some of the rooms although apparently not in all. Frankly, the staff did not seem that concerned about customer comfort. it is convernient, but there are several other hotels nearby that are also convenient. I definitely woulds not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay over the weekend. The staff was pleasant and professional and the price was right. The hotel is close to everything. It is a little tired at the edges but the people make up for it. M. Salmon

Reviews.Title: “review of mission valley resort in san diego”
Reviews.Author: irishtea
Reviews.Content: the hotel has senor frog gym( full gym) accessible with your stay at the hotel it has a lap pool, you can take classes etc...I enjoyed that however the gym closes 7pm on weekends and 9pm weekdays. The hotel has its own pool and jazuzzi which is nice. the staff was pleasant. the hotel is right off the freeway and many hotels around the area. Only one real place to eat near hotel with american food. Other wise you have to drive. I went to old town which is about a 10 minute drive. Very close to old town. I was in the back of the motel and there are not double pain windows. I did hear the freeway. I am a light sleeper. the walls are thin as well. The room had a coffee maker and a nice size tv. No refrig. I got a great deal on the hotel. I went 12/04 and the rate was around $60 with tax.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: grindergal
Reviews.Content: Overall, it was pretty nice. The resaurant on the property had good food and great service. The front desk staff was very nice. There was a cute little bar off the lobby and very nice grounds. My favorite part, though, was the gym. With your room key you get access to a lovely gym for free. I am a regular exerciser and the use of the health club was a main reason for my stay. Probably the nicest gym I have ever worked out at. SInce we took the train to San diego, my father and I were worried about transportation once at the hotel. Well, there were always cabs waiting in the parking lot, so this wasn't an issue. Unfortunately, there is a downside. The rooms were pretty bad. The rooms had a musky damp feel and smell to them and were very small. The Bathroom was ok. The bed was comfortable enough. It just didn't feel clean. Although, it was not the hotel's fault, there was a family next door to my room who's children laughed, screamed and yelled until I banged on the wall at eleven thirty. I would recommend this hotel, because we did get a good deal on it and hotels in San Diego are soooo expensive. But I didn't expect such dank, dark rooms.

Reviews.Title: “RUN to the nearest Motel 6!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Due to the price paid, and the word "resort" in it's name, I certainly expected much more. My daughter and I stayed, on vacation, for 3 nights. Where do I start? The carpet and bedding was damp when we walked in. Contributed it to the humidity, which I thought they would have done something, anything, to keep the rooms from feeling "sticky". The room itself is as pictured, however, is about half the size it appears to be. The remote to the tv didn't work, and when asked about it and told it would be changed, well, lets say we had to get up and down to change channels/volume the entire time. Maid service. Despite the "Privacy Please" sign, we were woken up at 7:30am by loud knocking from housekeeping. MAJOR no-no for me! The bathroom. When we arrived, there was hair in the sink, the lotion, shampoo and soap had all been USED and not replaced! GROSS GROSS GROSS. We ended up going to the store and buying our own. The major kicker - I paid for the room up front in cash, as well as a $150 security deposit, in cash. They turned around and charged my debit card the $150 deposit! When I realized I needed to get money from my ATM and discovered the "missing money", I asked the front desk if they charged my debit card. I got a very firm "No, we did not because you gave us cash". This was on Sunday. I couldn't call my bank until the next morning, which I did. Sure enough, they DID charge it AND take my cash. I had to fight with management in order to get them to release the hold at my bank so my daughter and I could return home! The staff - Most were very courteous, however, very lacking in their knowledge of giving correct directions or even knowing where the nearest Starbucks was (it's in Fashion Valley Mall, across the freeway!). When asking about transportation, they were a bit clueless to everything but the Old Town Trolley and making a call to a scuzzy cab company. The Restaurant and Liquor store - Saved the day! The store had soap, shampoo, every kind of first aid needed and tons of snacks. A bit pricey, but that's normal for a convenience store. The restaurant staff was wonderful, the food good but a little high priced for what you get. We found up the street a bit a place called Ricky's which we ate at the remainder of our time there. FABULOUS food, great service and prices you can't beat! Overall..........find a Motel 6! Much cheaper and the rooms are just as clean and accomodating, if not more, than Mission Valley Resort. We will NEVER stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Where to Begin...”
Reviews.Author: LossOfConsciousness
Reviews.Content: I am not a picky person. But this place...oh, where to begin. We booked the place despite some negative reviews on this site. Heck, there are negative reviews about our favourite hotel on this site, so we take it all with a shaker of salt. A mistake on my part. First of all, the positives. The family restaurant, though most portions of the food served was inviting Coronary Artery Disease (however I find this a US phenomenon not limited to this restaurant), was open late, had good service, and reasonably priced. The Liquor store next door was fabulous, perfect for late-night munchies and of course, the liquor, which we needed substantial amounts to get us through our reservation period at this hotel. The pool - nice, clean, beautiful surroundings with giant rose bushes and floral gardens. The fun stuff ends there folks. The room was dank, dark, the lights worked at varying intervals that could only be attributed to the lunar cycle, the carpet was dirty. It started out as an "OK" on the cleanliness factor, and deteriorated to "Disgusting" on the day we checked out. The bathtub did not drain - AT ALL. We left a comment about this on the "housekeeping comment card" which then proceeded to sit in the exact same table location we had left it on the first day. Of course, travelling with my mom and step-father - who is a hairy guy, if I may be so blunt - the tub and bathroom was filled with disgusting hair by the end of our trip. I hated taking a shower and didn't touch ANYTHING while I was in there. Oh yes, the supersonic toilet. I suppose this is a California water-saving thing, but the toilet had a button on top that you had to push to flush, and you had to pound on it to elicit any effect at all. When you pounded hard enough, the toilet flushed with such ferocity that I started hanging on to loose jewellry/hair/clothing lest I be sucked into the vortex never to be heard from again. Service was adequate, but I felt sorry for the folks who worked there - it has to be damaging to the self-esteem to be forced to wear a neon hawaiian shirt to work every single day. They also advertise the Trolley stops outside the front door. If the front door is Old Town State Park, which is a two mile drive away, they are correct. Trust me, I am not a whiner. I have stayed in some grotty hotels. This is the second grottiest. The only reason the other hotel in my grotty category wins first prize is that it had bullet holes in the door and no towels. But you would expect that in Detroit :)

Reviews.Title: “It's cheap and clean, anyway.”
Reviews.Author: JSurace
Reviews.Content: Well, it's cheap anyway... I have stayed here twice, in 2004. The first time they had apparently just changed from a Quality Inn, so perhaps the rough edges were due to the transition. Both times I booked via an internet service, just trying to find somewhere cheap. This is a very basic two-story walkup type place. Rooms are standard motel room, but are generally in very good repair, perhaps recently renovated. Location is convenient for freeway access to attractions downtown. The 24-hour restaurant is adequate for the very hungry having just arrived in town. The 24-hour convenience store is a big bonus, you can stock up on snacks. No view, you're on Hotel Circle, i.e. the freeway. The staff, however, have always been universally rude and unhelpful. Checking in takes forever, and the staff are not interested in room preferences, or indeed your very presence. Basically, it's clean and ok if you want somewhere cheap and easy in the increasingly expensive SD market.

Reviews.Title: “Mission Valley "Last" resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference in Jan 05. The staff could not handle the full house, check-in took over an hour with only 4 guests in front of me. They lost one reservation, forcing the gentleman to find another hotel, and they had another reservation under a completely different name. The non-smoking room I was in clearly had been smoked in and reeked of that hotel deodorizer. The hotel is right next to I-8 and the freeway noise is constant. The buildings were clearly built decades ago and have poor insulation and noise reduction. On the second day, the electronic lock broke on my door, forcing the staff to break in. After two hours working on the door I was told that it couldnt be fixed until the morning, and since there were no other rooms avalible, I would have to live with a door that doesen't lock. It took alot of arguing, but they "found" another room, which smelled just as bad. That day I came back to find that the cleaning staff had left my door ajar all day. On the plus side, the numerous pools are nice and the place is pretty kid friendly. The 24hr on-site resturant has awful food, but works in a pinch. Thankfully, there is a liquor store right next to the hotel. I would definatly rate this hotel as San Diego's "last" resort.
